an11.3:1.1: “Mendicants, an unethical person, who lacks ethics, has destroyed a vital condition for having no regrets.
an11.3:1.2: When there are regrets, one who has regrets has destroyed a vital condition for joy.
an11.3:1.3: When there is no joy, one who lacks joy has destroyed a vital condition for rapture.
an11.3:1.4: When there is no rapture, one who lacks rapture has destroyed a vital condition for tranquility.
an11.3:1.5: When there is no tranquility, one who lacks tranquility has destroyed a vital condition for bliss.
an11.3:1.6: When there is no bliss, one who lacks bliss has destroyed a vital condition for right immersion.
an11.3:1.7: When there is no right immersion, one who lacks right immersion has destroyed a vital condition for true knowledge and vision.
an11.3:1.8: When there is no true knowledge and vision, one who lacks true knowledge and vision has destroyed a vital condition for disillusionment.
an11.3:1.9: When there is no disillusionment, one who lacks disillusionment has destroyed a vital condition for dispassion.
an11.3:1.10: When there is no dispassion, one who lacks dispassion has destroyed a vital condition for knowledge and vision of freedom.
an11.3:2.1: Suppose there was a tree that lacked branches and foliage. Its shoots, bark, softwood, and heartwood would not grow to fullness.
an11.3:2.2: In the same way, an unethical person, who lacks ethics, has destroyed a vital condition for having no regrets.
an11.3:2.3: When there are regrets, one who has regrets has destroyed a vital condition for joy. …
an11.3:2.4: When there is no dispassion, one who lacks dispassion has destroyed a vital condition for knowledge and vision of freedom.
an11.3:3.1: An ethical person, who has fulfilled ethics, has fulfilled a vital condition for not having regrets.
an11.3:3.2: When there are no regrets, one who has no regrets has fulfilled a vital condition for joy.
an11.3:3.3: When there is joy, one who has fulfilled joy has fulfilled a vital condition for rapture.
an11.3:3.4: When there is rapture, one who has fulfilled rapture has fulfilled a vital condition for tranquility.
an11.3:3.5: When there is tranquility, one who has fulfilled tranquility has fulfilled a vital condition for bliss.
an11.3:3.6: When there is bliss, one who has fulfilled bliss has fulfilled a vital condition for right immersion.
an11.3:3.7: When there is right immersion, one who has fulfilled right immersion has fulfilled a vital condition for true knowledge and vision.
an11.3:3.8: When there is true knowledge and vision, one who has fulfilled true knowledge and vision has fulfilled a vital condition for disillusionment.
an11.3:3.9: When there is disillusionment, one who has fulfilled disillusionment has fulfilled a vital condition for dispassion.
an11.3:3.10: When there is dispassion, one who has fulfilled dispassion has fulfilled a vital condition for knowledge and vision of freedom.
an11.3:4.1: Suppose there was a tree that was complete with branches and foliage. Its shoots, bark, softwood, and heartwood would grow to fullness.
an11.3:4.2: In the same way, an ethical person, who has fulfilled ethics, has fulfilled a vital condition for not having regrets.
an11.3:4.3: When there are no regrets, one who has no regrets has fulfilled a vital condition for joy. …
an11.3:4.4: When there is dispassion, one who has fulfilled dispassion has fulfilled a vital condition for knowledge and vision of freedom.”
